subject: Education
title: Democratic Free Schools: Students Make Rules
description: A quick win: understand Democratic Free Schools: Students Make Rules.

hook.text: At Sudbury Valley School, students vote on every rule. A 6-year-old's vote counts the same as a teacher's.

discovery.text: Graduates report high life satisfaction and pursue unconventional careers. Many start businesses or become artists.

twist.text: Critics worry kids miss essential skills. What if a student never chooses math? The school says that's their right.

climax.text: Democratic schools test a radical idea: children learn best when trusted. The results are surprisingly positive.

punchline.text: What happens when kids run the school? They learn to run their lives.

quiz.question: What is unique about voting at Sudbury Valley School?
options: Students and teachers have equal votes
